org.jetel.graph

Class TransformationGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.TransformationGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGraphElement

    public final class TransformationGraph
extends GraphElement
    A class that represents Transformation Graph - all the Nodes and connecting Edges
    Since:
    April 2, 2002
    See Also:
    WatchDog

      • setStaticJobType

        public void setStaticJobType(JobType jobType)
        Sets static JobType for this transformation graph. Static JobType is a JobType derived from type of file from which the graph has been created. This static JobType can be different from runtime JobType in GraphRuntimeContext.getJobType(). For example subgraph (*.sgrf) executed from a jobflow has static JobType JobType.SUBGRAPH but runtime JobType is JobType.SUBJOBFLOW.

      • getRuntimeJobType

        public JobType getRuntimeJobType()
        Returns runtime job type. Can be different from static JobType (getStaticJobType()). For example *.sgrf file executed as root job, has static job type JobType.SUBGRAPH, but runtime jobtype is JobType.ETL_GRAPH.
        Specified by:
        getRuntimeJobType in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        getRuntimeJobType in class GraphElement

      • getStaticJobType

        public JobType getStaticJobType()
        Gets static JobType for this transformation graph. Static JobType is a JobType derived from type of file from which the graph has been created. This static JobType can be different from runtime JobType in GraphRuntimeContext.getJobType(). For example subgraph (*.sgrf) executed from a jobflow has static JobType JobType.SUBGRAPH but runtime JobType is JobType.SUBJOBFLOW.

      • getPersistedImplicitMetadata

        public DataRecordMetadata getPersistedImplicitMetadata(java.lang.String id)
        Persited metadata are used for validation purpose. All edges with implicit metadata has reference to one of these metadata. The calculated implicit metadata is compared with the persisted one, must be identical.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        persisted implicit metadata with the given id

        metadata -

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        preExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

public void reset()

        See Also:
        IGraphElement.reset()

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for a single graph run. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.preExecute() method should be released here. It is guaranteed that this method is invoked after graph finish at the latest. For some graph elements, for instance components, is this method called immediately after phase finish.
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        postExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with success - Result.FINISHED_OK. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if all graph processing was completely successful. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        commit in class GraphElement

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with error or was aborted - Result.ERROR, Result.ABORTED. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if some part of graph failed. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        rollback in class GraphElement

      • addDataRecordMetadata

        public void addDataRecordMetadata(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> metadata)
        Bulk registration of metadata objects. Mainly used by TransformationGraphXMLReaderWriter.

        Important!
        Map values are usually DataRecordMetadata, but may contain other classes, specifically DataRecordMetadataStub.

        Parameters:
        metadata - Map object containing metadata IDs and metadata objects.

      • checkConfig

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.
        Specified by:
        checkConfig in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        checkConfig in class GraphElement

      • getWatchDog

        public WatchDog getWatchDog()
        Returns reference to WatchDog - a thread which orchestrates all phases/nodes at runtime.
        It also contains detailed information about errors which caused stop of transformation processing.
        Returns:
        the watchDog
        Since:
        10.1.2007

      • isAnalysed

        public boolean isAnalysed()
        Returns:
        true if the graph has been already analysed by TransformationGraphAnalyzer.analyseGraph(TransformationGraph, GraphRuntimeContext, boolean)

      • setAnalysed

      • getExecutionLabel

        public java.lang.String getExecutionLabel()
        Execution label is human-readable text which describes this graph execution. Can be parametrised by graph parameters.
        Returns:
        resolved execution label for this graph instance
